immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus: Gaining hands-on experience with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, underwater robots (ROVs and submersibles), and related US-based groups and universities.  Priority is on immediate, accessible opportunities for practical application.

Key Interests: US universities with strong ocean engineering programs relevant to underwater volcanology, undersea habitat design, and ROV/submersible technology; US-based meetups and scuba events focused on underwater robotics and habitats; identifying and connecting with individuals and groups actively involved in underwater habitat design and submersible operation; securing hands-on training and participation opportunities (courses, workshops, internships) at US universities and organizations specializing in these areas.

Immediate Priorities: Identifying and applying to relevant US university programs offering hands-on experience in underwater habitat design and ROV/submersible operation; directly contacting US-based organizations involved in underwater volcanology and undersea habitat research; attending relevant diving/scuba events and technical meetups; actively seeking mentorship and collaboration opportunities with experts in underwater habitat design and submersible technology.

Research Priorities: ROV and submersible applications in deep-sea volcanic environments; the design, construction, and operation of undersea habitats; practical submersible and ROV operation and maintenance; identifying key personnel and active research projects at US universities and organizations offering hands-on experience in these areas.  Emphasis on immediately available, practical training and participation opportunities.
